channel.title: BBC News - Technology
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: The women who left their jobs to code
item.description: Studies suggest women are less likely to work in tech than men but some are bucking the trend.

item.title: ChatGPT: Mayor starts legal bid over false bribery claim
item.description: Brian Hood says chatbot ChatGPT spread false information about him serving time in prison.

item.title: Bob Lee dead: Cash App founder dies after San Francisco stabbing
item.description: The 43-year-old tech guru died after being stabbed on a San Francisco street, his family says.

item.title: Genesis Market: Popular cybercrime website shut down by police
item.description: Genesis Market allowed online fraudsters to buy passwords and other personal data for less than $1.

item.title: Amazon closing UK-based online shop Book Depository
item.description: The announcement was met with sadness by many of its customers from around the world.

item.title: Terry Gou: Foxconn founder in fresh run for Taiwan presidency
item.description: Terry Gou is aiming to be nominated from the Kuomintang, which traditionally favours close ties with China.

item.title: TikTok fined £12.7m for misusing children's data
item.description: The data regulator finds TikTok "did not do enough" to check the ages of who was using their platform.

item.title: Martha Lane Fox warns against hysteria over AI
item.description: The tech pioneer told the BBC we should see artificial intelligence as an opportunity.

item.title: Virgin Orbit: Richard Branson's rocket firm files for bankruptcy
item.description: The satellite launch company has failed to secure new investment after a rocket launch failed.

item.title: Twitter's blue ticks disappear as Musk attacks NY Times
item.description: The New York Times Twitter account has lost its blue tick after it said it would not pay to stay verified.

item.title: Mobile phone inventor made first call 50 years ago
item.description: Marty Cooper, who made the first mobile phone call in 1973, says modern devices are "suboptimal".

item.title: ChatGPT banned in Italy over privacy concerns
item.description: The country's data-protection regulator has serious privacy concerns over the technology.

item.title: Tesla: Carmaker told to pay ex-worker $3.2m over racism case
item.description: The payment has been slashed from the original award of $137m when the case was heard in 2021.

item.title: 'Psychological warfare': US politicians grill TikTok boss
item.description: The TikTok CEO faced US lawmakers during a Congressional hearing on the app's practices.

item.title: Ros Atkins on... The creeping TikTok bans
item.description: The app is banned from employee phones by various governments amid security concerns.

item.title: A nutty solution for cleaner stoves and barbecues
item.description: Cleaner fuels for cooking could improve health and be better for the environment.

item.title: The other Chinese apps taking the US and UK by storm
item.description: Four out of the top 10 most downloaded free mobile apps in the US and UK are Chinese-owned.

item.title: Would you open up to a chatbot therapist?
item.description: AI-powered chatbots are now sophisticated enough that they are starting to be used for therapy.

item.title: Friend or foe: Can computer coders trust ChatGPT?
item.description: The artificial intelligence ChatGPT can write computer code, but its help comes with many potential problems.

item.title: The tech helping driverless cars see round corners
item.description: A trial in London used existing street cameras to help an autonomous car navigate city streets.

item.title: Crewless container ships appear on the horizon
item.description: Autonomous container ships are undergoing trials with crewless voyages planned in the next two years.

item.title: ‘I left teaching to train as a heat pump engineer’
item.description: Heat pumps could radically cut household CO2 emissions, but there's a shortage of qualified installers.

item.title: The revolution underway in India's diamond industry
item.description: India's long history with diamonds enters a new chapter as lab-grown versions of the gem take off.

item.title: Could waste plastic become a useful fuel source?
item.description: A process that turns waste plastic and CO2 into fuel has been developed at Cambridge University.

item.title: Is there a better way to insulate our draughty homes?
item.description: Aerogel is described as the most effective insulating material known to science, so why isn't it used more?

item.title: How slimmed-down websites can cut their carbon emissions
item.description: Businesses are discovering tweaks that can dramatically reduce the environmental impact of their websites.
